document.docAuthor: Gagné, Raymond J., Kay, Fernando Mc & Heard, Tim A.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Neolasioptera (Diptera: Cecidomyiidae) from Parkinsonia aculeata (Leguminosae) in Argentina for possible use in biological control in Australia, with a key to Neotropical species of Neolasioptera

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Neolasioptera (Diptera: Cecidomyiidae) from Parkinsonia aculeata (Leguminosae) in Argentina for possible use in biological control in Australia, with a key to Neotropical species of Neolasioptera

heading.emphasis:
Key to Neotropical species of
Neolasioptera

subSubSection.paragraph:
This is the first key to
Neolasioptera
species known from the Neotropics, of which there are currently 65 species. It will serve to differentiate
N . aculeatae
from all other known species of Neotropical
Neolasioptera
. The key groups only broadly most of the other known species but is proffered as a first attempt at sorting out these many species. Without knowing all of them in more detail, it is impractical to key all the species individually at this point. Citations and hosts for each species in the key and for the six other species that immediately follow can be found in Gagné (2004 , 2010 ). The key is based mainly on the larval third (last) instar spatula, which, by all evidence to date, is consistent in size and shape within a species. Fortunately, this structure has been illustrated for most species. The five species for which the spatula is unknown, and a sixth species with the spatula previously undescribed, are separated from
N . aculeatae
immediately following the key.

paragraph.keyLead:
1 Spatula absent...................................
N. compositarum Möhn
,
N. malvavisci Möhn
and
N. serrata Möhn

2 Spatula reduced anteriorly to a single, diminutive, rounded tooth and posteriorly to a short shaft barely longer than the tooth........................................................................................
N. parvula Möhn

3 Spatula with 2 teeth separated by minute serrations............................................
N. verbesinae Möhn

4 Spatula with only 2 teeth...............
N. eugeniae Maia
,
N. heterothalami (Kieffer & Jörgensen)
and
N. rostrata Gagné

5 Spatula with 4 teeth..................................................
N. erigerontis (Felt)
and
N. fariae (Tavares)

6 Spatula cruciate, with definite anterolateral extensions (as in
Fig. 15
)..................................................
N. aeschynomensis Brèthes
,
N. amaranthi Möhn
,
N. borreriae Möhn
,
N. brickelliae Möhn
,
N. camarae Möhn
,
N. capsici Möhn
,
N. cimarronensis Möhn
,
N. cissampeli Möhn
,
N. cruttwellae Gagné
,
N. cupheae Gagné
,
N. cusani Wünsch
,
N. diclipterae Wünsch
,
N. donamae Wünsch
,
N. exeupatorii Gagné
,
N. hibisci (Felt)
,
N. hyptis Möhn
,
N. lantanae (Tavares)
,
N. lapalmae Möhn
,
N. martelli Nijveldt
,
N. melantheri Möhn
,
N. merremiae Möhn
,
N. mincae Wünsch
,
N. monticola (Kieffer & Herbst)
,
N. olivae Wünsch
,
N. portulacae (Cook)
,
N. ramicola Maia
,
N. salviae Möhn
,

,
N. tournefortiae Möhn
,
N. tribulae Wünsch
,
N. tridentifera (Kieffer & Jörgensen)
and
N. vernoniensis Möhn

7 Middle tooth of spatula at least as long as lateral teeth..........................................................
N. aphelandrae Möhn
,
N. celtis Möhn
,
N. cerei (Rübsaamen)
,
N. cestri Möhn
,
N. cordiae Möhn
,
N. dentata Möhn
,
N. exigua Möhn
,
N. frugivora Gagné
,
N. heliocarpi Möhn
,
N. indigoferae Möhn
,
N. iresinis Möhn
and
N. odontonemae Möhn
- Middle tooth of spatula shorter than the lateral teeth......................................................... 8

8 Lateral teeth robust, appreciably more than twice length of middle tooth.............................................................................
N. erythroxyli Möhn
,
N. grandis Möhn
,
N. ingae Möhn
and
N. salvadorensis Möhn
- Lateral teeth no more than twice length of middle tooth....................................................... 9

9 Terminal larval segment with 4 papillae.............................
N. caleae Möhn
and
N. pseudocalymmae Möhn

10 Female
fused cerci bulbous...........................................
N. clematicola Möhn
and
N. combreti Möhn

- Female fused cerci cylindrical (
Fig. 8
)......................................................
N. aculeatae Gagné
